trends: There have been 3 other sightings in Wheaton
There were no other sightings in Wheaton on or around May 13th 2008
divs: Sighting DetailsAt approximately 23:00 on May 13 Tuesday , I was driving West on University blvd. in Wheaton Md between Georgia ave. and Viersmill Rd. and I looked up and to my right and saw large fireball with comet-like tail at 35-45 degree angle to my car I.E. to the right and up 60-75 degrees angle from horizon . It arced down ...its heading NE at top of visible arc and down to the ESE OR SSE out of vision near horizon in 3-5 seconds. It was big enough , if far away , to make me think of the "Dinosaurs Extinction" and I waited a little nervously for its impact sound which didn't occur. So I thought it probably landed far away or burned up completely before it hit . Since it was a fireball , I assumed it was passing through the earth's atmosphere and was possibly space garbage reentering like the French ESA craft loaded with garbage will if it hasen't already, as it descends from the ISS. It is the largest meteor (shooting star) I have ever seen , if thats what it was. I reported it to the US Airforce and to NICAP and Montgomery County Police.
Summary: Saw large comet like fieball - fireball angle to horizon 60-70deg steep arc down to horizon- Direction ENE to ESE
